conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the metal rod when a current is passed through it.
Understand the magnetic force on the current-carrying rod and how it affects the springs.
Magnetic force on the rod when current is from b to a is downward.
Magnetic force on the rod when current is from a to b is upward.
When current is from b to a, magnetic force is balanced by the weight of the rod.
Weight of the rod is mg, where m is mass and g is gravity.
Magnetic force is F_m = B I_1 L.
Magnetic force equals weight of the rod: B I_1 L = mg.
When current is from a to b, magnetic force is upward and springs will be stretched.
New force balance equation: B I_2 L - mg = 2kx.
Substitute mg with B I_1 L: B I_2 L - B I_1 L = 2kx.
Solve for x: x = (B L (I_2 - I_1)) / (2k).
Final answer: The elongation of the springs is (B L (I_2 - I_1)) / (2k).
